00034 /** @file stmt.h
00035     @brief File with declarations for classes related to statements in the language
00036 */
00037 
00038 #ifndef ISPC_STMT_H
00039 #define ISPC_STMT_H 1
00040 
00041 #include "ispc.h"
00042 
00043 /** @brief Interface class for statements in the ispc language.
00044 
00045     This abstract base-class encapsulates methods that AST nodes for
00046     statements in the language must implement.
00047  */
00048 class Stmt : public ASTNode {
00049 public:
00050     Stmt(SourcePos p) : ASTNode(p) { }
00051 
00052     /** Emit LLVM IR for the statement, using the FunctionEmitContext to create the
00053         necessary instructions.
00054      */
00055     virtual void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const = 0;
00056 
00057     /** Print a representation of the statement (and any children AST
00058         nodes) to standard output.  This method is used for debuggins. */
00059     virtual void Print(int indent) const = 0;
00060 
00061     // Redeclare these methods with Stmt * return values, rather than
00062     // ASTNode *s, as in the original ASTNode declarations of them.
00063     virtual Stmt *Optimize() = 0;
00064     virtual Stmt *TypeCheck() = 0;
00065 };
00066 
00067 
00068 /** @brief Statement representing a single expression */
00069 class ExprStmt : public Stmt {
00070 public:
00071     ExprStmt(Expr *expr, SourcePos pos);
00072 
00073     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00074     void Print(int indent) const;
00075 
00076     Stmt *Optimize();
00077     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00078     int EstimateCost() const;
00079 
00080     Expr *expr;
00081 };
00082

00084 /** @brief Statement representing a single declaration (which in turn may declare
00085     a number of variables. */
00086 class DeclStmt : public Stmt {
00087 public:
00088     DeclStmt(SourcePos pos, Declaration *declaration, SymbolTable *symbolTable);
00089 
00090     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00091     void Print(int indent) const;
00092 
00093     Stmt *Optimize();
00094     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00095     int EstimateCost() const;
00096 
00097     Declaration *declaration;
00098 };

00101 /** @brief Statement representing a single if statement, possibly with an
00102     else clause. */
00103 class IfStmt : public Stmt {
00104 public:
00105     IfStmt(Expr *testExpr, Stmt *trueStmts, Stmt *falseStmts,
00106            bool doAllCheck, SourcePos pos);
00107 
00108     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00109     void Print(int indent) const;
00110 
00111     Stmt *Optimize();
00112     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00113     int EstimateCost() const;
00114 
00115     // @todo these are only public for lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(); would
00116     // be nice to clean that up...
00117     /** Expression giving the 'if' test. */
00118     Expr *test;
00119     /** Statements to run if the 'if' test returns a true value */
00120     Stmt *trueStmts;
00121     /** Statements to run if the 'if' test returns a false value */
00122     Stmt *falseStmts;
00123 
00124 private:
00125     /** This value records if this was a 'coherent' if statement in the
00126         source and thus, if the emitted code should check to see if all
00127         active program instances want to follow just one of the 'true' or
00128         'false' blocks. */
00129     const bool doAllCheck;
00130     const bool doAnyCheck;
00131 
00132     void emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00133                                 llvm::Value *test) const;
00134     void emitVaryingIf(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test) const;
00135     void emitMaskAllOn(FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
00136                        llvm::Value *test, llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const;
00137     void emitMaskMixed(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00138                        llvm::Value *test, llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const;
00139 };

00142 /** @brief Statement implementation representing a 'do' statement in the
00143     program.
00144  */
00145 class DoStmt : public Stmt {
00146 public:
00147     DoStmt(Expr *testExpr, Stmt *bodyStmts, bool doCoherentCheck, 
00148            SourcePos pos);
00149 
00150     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00151     void Print(int indent) const;
00152 
00153     Stmt *Optimize();
00154     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00155     int EstimateCost() const;
00156 
00157     Expr *testExpr;
00158     Stmt *bodyStmts;
00159     const bool doCoherentCheck;
00160 };

00163 /** @brief Statement implementation for 'for' loops (as well as for 'while'
00164     loops).
00165  */
00166 class ForStmt : public Stmt {
00167 public:
00168     ForStmt(Stmt *initializer, Expr *testExpr, Stmt *stepStatements,
00169             Stmt *bodyStatements, bool doCoherentCheck, SourcePos pos);
00170 
00171     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00172     void Print(int indent) const;
00173 
00174     Stmt *Optimize();
00175     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00176     int EstimateCost() const;
00177 
00178     /** 'for' statment initializer; may be NULL, indicating no intitializer */
00179     Stmt *init;
00180     /** expression that returns a value indicating whether the loop should
00181         continue for the next iteration */
00182     Expr *test;
00183     /** Statements to run at the end of the loop for the loop step, before
00184         the test expression is evaluated. */
00185     Stmt *step;
00186     /** Loop body statements */
00187     Stmt *stmts;
00188     const bool doCoherentCheck;
00189 };

00191 
00192 /** @brief Statement implementation for a break or 'coherent' break
00193     statement in the program. */
00194 class BreakStmt : public Stmt {
00195 public:
00196     BreakStmt(bool doCoherenceCheck, SourcePos pos);
00197 
00198     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00199     void Print(int indent) const;
00200 
00201     Stmt *Optimize();
00202     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00203     int EstimateCost() const;
00204 
00205 private:
00206     /** This indicates whether the generated code will check to see if no
00207         more program instances are currently running after the break, in
00208         which case the code can have a jump to the end of the current
00209         loop. */
00210     const bool doCoherenceCheck;
00211 };
00212

00214 /** @brief Statement implementation for a continue or 'coherent' continue
00215     statement in the program. */
00216 class ContinueStmt : public Stmt {
00217 public:
00218     ContinueStmt(bool doCoherenceCheck, SourcePos pos);
00219 
00220     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00221     void Print(int indent) const;
00222 
00223     Stmt *Optimize();
00224     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00225     int EstimateCost() const;
00226 
00227 private:
00228     /** This indicates whether the generated code will check to see if no
00229         more program instances are currently running after the continue, in
00230         which case the code can have a jump to the end of the current
00231         loop. */
00232     const bool doCoherenceCheck;
00233 };

00236 /** @brief Statement implementation for a 'return' or 'coherent' return
00237     statement in the program. */
00238 class ReturnStmt : public Stmt {
00239 public:
00240     ReturnStmt(Expr *v, bool cc, SourcePos p);
00241 
00242     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00243     void Print(int indent) const;
00244 
00245     Stmt *Optimize();
00246     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00247     int EstimateCost() const;
00248 
00249     Expr *val;
00250     /** This indicates whether the generated code will check to see if no
00251         more program instances are currently running after the return, in
00252         which case the code can possibly jump to the end of the current
00253         function. */
00254     const bool doCoherenceCheck;
00255 };

00258 /** @brief Representation of a list of statements in the program.
00259  */
00260 class StmtList : public Stmt {
00261 public:
00262     StmtList(SourcePos p) : Stmt(p) { }
00263 
00264     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00265     void Print(int indent) const;
00266 
00267     Stmt *Optimize();
00268     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00269     int EstimateCost() const;
00270 
00271     void Add(Stmt *s) { if (s) stmts.push_back(s); }
00272     const std::vector<Stmt *> &GetStatements() { return stmts; }
00273 
00274 private:
00275     std::vector<Stmt *> stmts;
00276 };
00277 
00278 
00279 /** @brief Representation of a print() statement in the program.
00280 
00281     It's currently necessary to have a special statement type for print()
00282     since strings aren't supported as first-class types in the language,
00283     but we need to be able to pass a formatting string as the first
00284     argument to print().  We also need this to be a variable argument
00285     function, which also isn't supported.  Representing print() as a
00286     statement lets us work around both of those ugly little issues...
00287   */
00288 class PrintStmt : public Stmt {
00289 public:
00290     PrintStmt(const std::string &f, Expr *v, SourcePos p);
00291 
00292     void EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const;
00293     void Print(int indent) const;
00294 
00295     Stmt *Optimize();
00296     Stmt *TypeCheck();
00297     int EstimateCost() const;
00298 
00299     /** Format string for the print() statement. */
00300     const std::string format;
00301     /** This holds the arguments passed to the print() statement.  If more
00302         than one was provided, this will be an ExprList. */
00303     Expr *values;
00304 };
